info.title: openconfig-aaa
info.description:
This module defines configuration and operational state data
    related to authorization, authentication, and accounting (AAA)
    management.

    Portions of this model reuse data definitions or structure from
    RFC 7317 - A YANG Data Model for System Management

**Module:** `openconfig-aaa`
**Paths:** 3

put.description: Create or replace Top-level container for AAA services

patch.description: Partially modify Top-level container for AAA services

delete.description: Delete Top-level container for AAA services

get.description: Configuration data for top level AAA services

put.description: Create or replace Configuration data for top level AAA services

patch.description: Partially modify Configuration data for top level AAA services

delete.description: Delete Configuration data for top level AAA services

get.description: Operational state data for top level AAA services

put.description: Create or replace Operational state data for top level AAA services

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data for top level AAA services

delete.description: Delete Operational state data for top level AAA services

items.description:
Ordered list of authentication methods for users.  This
        can be either a reference to a server group, or a well-
        defined designation in the AAA_METHOD_TYPE identity.  If
        authentication fails with one method, the next defined
        method is tried -- failure of all methods results in the
        user being denied access.

admin-password.description:
The admin/root password, supplied as a cleartext string.
        The system should hash and only store the password as a
        hashed value.

admin-password-hashed.description:
The admin/root password, supplied as a hashed value
        using the notation described in the definition of the
        crypt-password-type.

admin-username.description:
Name of the administrator user account, e.g., admin, root,
        etc.

admin-password.description:
The admin/root password, supplied as a cleartext string.
        The system should hash and only store the password as a
        hashed value.

admin-password-hashed.description:
The admin/root password, supplied as a hashed value
        using the notation described in the definition of the
        crypt-password-type.

Name of the administrator user account, e.g., admin, root,
        etc.

The admin/root password, supplied as a cleartext string.
        The system should hash and only store the password as a
        hashed value.

The admin/root password, supplied as a hashed value
        using the notation described in the definition of the
        crypt-password-type.

username.description: References the configured username for the user

password.description:
The user password, supplied as cleartext.  The system
        must hash the value and only store the hashed value.

        using the notation described in the definition of the
        crypt-password-type.

ssh-key.description: SSH public key for the user (RSA or DSA)

role.description:
Role assigned to the user.  The role may be supplied
        as a string or a role defined by the SYSTEM_DEFINED_ROLES
        identity.

items.description:

        can be either a reference to a server group, or a well-
        defined designation in the AAA_METHOD_TYPE identity.  If
        authentication fails with one method, the next defined
        method is tried -- failure of all methods results in the

config.description: Configuration data for global authentication services

items.description:
Ordered list of authentication methods for users.  This
        can be either a reference to a server group, or a well-
        defined designation in the AAA_METHOD_TYPE identity.  If
        authentication fails with one method, the next defined
        method is tried -- failure of all methods results in the
        user being denied access.

state.description:
Operational state data for global authentication
          services

authentication.description: Top-level container for global authentication data

items.description:
Ordered list of methods for authorizing commands.  The first
        method that provides a response (positive or negative) should
        be used.  The list may contain a well-defined method such
        as the set of all TACACS or RADIUS servers, or the name of
        a defined AAA server group.  The system must validate
        that the named server group exists.

event-type.description:
Reference to the event-type being logged at the
            accounting server

Reference to the event-type being logged at the
            accounting server

record.description:
Send START record to the accounting server at the
            beginning of the activity, and STOP record at the
            end of the activity.

event-type.description:
The type of activity to record at the AAA accounting
        server

Send START record to the accounting server at the

            end of the activity.

authorization.description:
Top-level container for AAA authorization configuration
        and operational state data

items.description:
An ordered list of methods used for AAA accounting for this
         event type.  The method is defined by the destination for
        accounting data, which may be specified as the group of
        all TACACS+/RADIUS servers, a defined server group, or
        the local system.

record.description:
Send START record to the accounting server at the
            beginning of the activity, and STOP record at the
            end of the activity.

state.description: Operational state data for user accounting.

name.description: Reference to configured name of the server group

type.description:
AAA server type -- all servers in the group must be of this
        type

address.description: Reference to the configured address of the AAA server

timeout.description:
Set the timeout in seconds on responses from the AAA
        server

connection-opens.description:
Number of new connection requests sent to the server, e.g.
        socket open

connection-closes.description:
Number of connection close requests sent to the server, e.g.
        socket close

connection-aborts.description:
Number of aborted connections to the server.  These do
        not include connections that are close gracefully.

connection-failures.description: Number of connection failures to the server

connection-timeouts.description: Number of connection timeouts to the server

messages-sent.description: Number of messages sent to the server

messages-received.description: Number of messages received by the server

errors-received.description: Number of error messages received from the server

tags.name: openconfig-aaa
tags.description:
This module defines configuration and operational state data
    related to authorization, authentication, and accounting (AAA)
    management.

    Portions of this model reuse data definitions or structure from
    RFC 7317 - A YANG Data Model for System Management
